pullRequest.body:
This PR adds the theorem `UniformContinuous.iterate` claiming that if a function `T` is uniformly continuous in a uniform space `Î²`, then its `n`-th iterate `T^[n]` is also uniformly continuous.

Co-authored-by: @D-Thomine 

---

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

Ok, I should have addressed all the review requests.

Thank you very much @sgouezel for your review!

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9650105777/job/26615052668)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9650105777/job/26615053055)
The name is bad, because `ite` means `if then else`. What about `UniformContinuous.iterate`?
Does `induction` work instead of `induction'`? (It is more canonical).

No, it doesn't work if I naively substitute it for `induction'`.

Moreover, `induction'` is used in this file and quite extensively in Mathlib (about 1893 times in 667 files).

Sure, naive substitution won't work, but `induction'` is suboptimal and will probably be removed some day, so better learn the new syntax. Can you figure it out (for instance looking for `induction n` around)? If you can't, I can show you how it should be done, but I think it's more instructive to let you find out.
Sure, I'll do it as soon as I can.
No #align for new statements, just remove this line.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Topology/UniformSpace): add `UniformContinuous.iterate `
